com.stormpath.sdk.group
Interface GroupOptions<T>

All Superinterfaces:
Options
All Known Subinterfaces:
GroupCriteria
public interface GroupOptions<T>
extends Options

Group-specific options that may be specified when retrieving Group resources.

Since:
0.8

Method Detail

withCustomData

T withCustomData()
Ensures that when retrieving a Group, the Group's customData is also retrieved in the same request. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

Returns:
this instance for method chaining.

withDirectory

T withDirectory()
Ensures that when retrieving a Group, the Group's parent directory is also retrieved in the same request. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

Returns:
this instance for method chaining.

withTenant

T withTenant()
Ensures that when retrieving a Group, the Group's owning Group.getTenant() tenant} is also retrieved in the same request. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

Returns:
this instance for method chaining.

withAccounts

T withAccounts()
Ensures that when retrieving a Group, the Groups's assigned Group.getAccounts() accounts} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated). This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

If you wish to control pagination parameters (offset and limit) for the returned groups, see the withAccounts(limit) or withAccounts(limit,offset) methods.

Returns:
this instance for method chaining.

withAccounts

T withAccounts(int limit)
Ensures that when retrieving a Group, the Group's assigned Group.getAccounts() accounts} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), limiting the first page of account results to limit items. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

Parameters:
limit - the number of results in the Account collection's first page. Min: 1, Max: 100.
Returns:
this instance for method chaining.

withAccounts

T withAccounts(int limit,
               int offset)
Ensures that when retrieving a Group, the Group's assigned Group.getAccounts() accounts} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated) , with the first page of account results starting at the specified offset index and limiting the number of results to limit items. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

Parameters:
limit - the number of results in the Account collection's first page. Min: 1, Max: 100.
offset - the starting index of the first Account to retrieve in the overall Account collection's result set.
Returns:
this instance for method chaining.

withAccountMemberships

T withAccountMemberships()
Ensures that when retrieving a Group, the Group's associated accountMemberships are also retrieved in the same request (paginated). This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

If you wish to control pagination parameters (offset and limit) for the returned accountMemberships, see the withAccountMemberships(limit) or withAccountMemberships(limit,offset) methods.

Returns:
this instance for method chaining.

withAccountMemberships

T withAccountMemberships(int limit)
Ensures that when retrieving a Group, the Group's associated Group.getAccountMemberships() accountMemberships} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), limiting the first page of results to limit items. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

Parameters:
limit - the number of results in the membership collection's first page. Min: 1, Max: 100.
Returns:
this instance for method chaining.

withAccountMemberships

T withAccountMemberships(int limit,
                         int offset)
Ensures that when retrieving a Group, the Group's associated Group.getAccountMemberships() accountMemberships} are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), with the first page of results starting at the specified offset index and limiting the number of results to limit items. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

Parameters:
limit - the number of results in the membership collection's first page. Min: 1, Max: 100.
offset - the starting index of the first membership to retrieve in the overall membership collection's result set.
Returns:
this instance for method chaining.
